alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 21 at 2:10AM MST until February 21 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TODAY FROM 10 AM THROUGH 7 PM FOR LOCALES ALONG AND EAST OF THE CENTRAL MOUNTAINS BELOW SIGNIFICANT SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY VALUES, AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... .Increasing winds in combination with very dry conditions and fuels, above normal readings, and an unstable atmosphere will create several hours of critical fire weather conditions along and east of the central mountains below significant snowpack. Brief critical conditions could also develop across southern Socorro County, but fuels may not be as susceptible for rapid fire growth in this region. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the East Central Plains, Northeast Plains, Northeast Highlands and the Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains below significant snowpack late this morning through early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwesterly 20 to 35 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values between 9 and 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning on Monday.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains
